solution_line_template: The salesman sold {bags_sold_group1} bags for {bags_sold_group1} bags x ${price_group1}/bag = $<<{bags_sold_group1}*{price_group1}={revenue_group1}>>{revenue_group1}
He sold {bags_sold_group2} more for {bags_sold_group2} bags x ${price_group2}/bag = $<<{bags_sold_group2}*{price_group2}={revenue_group2}>>{revenue_group2}
Thus far he has sold {bags_sold_group1} bags + {bags_sold_group2} bags = <<{bags_sold_group1}+{bags_sold_group2}={total_bags_sold_two_groups}>>{total_bags_sold_two_groups} bags

Therefore he sold {total_initial_bags} bags - {total_bags_sold_two_groups} bags = <<{total_initial_bags}-{total_bags_sold_two_groups}={bags_sold_group3}>>{bags_sold_group3} bags for ${price_group3} each
{bags_sold_group3} bags were sold for {bags_sold_group3} bags x ${price_group3}/bag = $<<{bags_sold_group3}*{price_group3}={revenue_group3}>>{revenue_group3}
